intro: Schrankia angustisiliqua, commonly known as the narrow-leaf schrankia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Schrankia angustisiliqua is often found in coastal and inland grassland habitats.
